greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of meanders filling out an n X k grid.
comment: The sequence counts the distinct closed paths that visit every cell of an n-by-k rectangular lattice at least once, that never cross any edge between adjacent squares more than once, and that do not self-intersect. Paths related by rotation and/or reflection of the square lattice are not considered distinct.
formula: T(n,3) appears to be equal to A090597.
example: The 14 solutions for (n,k)=(5,4), 63 solutions for (n,k)=(6,4) and 224 solutions for (n,k)=(7,4) are illustrated in the supporting png files.
xref: Cf. A200000 (sequence of entries for square grid).
results.author: _Jon Wild_, Nov 23 2011
